1.brief: properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

2.brief: a deep place (of water or mud)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a stream (as flowing); also an ear of grain (as growing out); by analogy, a branch
to gush; by implication, to inundate, cleanse; by analogy, to gallop, conquer

3.brief: properly, to gasp; hence, to be exhausted, to tire, to toil
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to glow, i.e. literally (to melt, burn, dry up) or figuratively (to show or incite passion)
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

4.brief: properly, to cast together , i.e. increase, especially in number; to multiply by the myriad
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
gratis, i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage
to bind fast, i.e. close (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) powerful or numerous; to crunch the bones
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

5.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
guiltiness, a fault, the presentation of asin-offering
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy

6.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

8.brief: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)

properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
an opening, i.e. door or gate
properly, instrumental music; by implication, a stringed instrument; by extension, a poem set to music; specifically, an epigram
an intoxicant, i.e. intensely alcoholic liquor

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
